main_definition: The word 'inter' is a preposition or an adverb used to describe action occurring between two or more entities, objects, or concepts.

meanings_and_examples.example: In the interim period, we will be evaluating new market strategies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Acting as an agent or medium of communication between two parties
meanings_and_examples.example: The mediator played a vital role in facilitating talks between the disputing nations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Involving, dealing with, or concerning more than one person or thing
meanings_and_examples.example: She has wide interpersonal skills that help her to work effectively with diverse teams.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to the field of psychology and mental processes
meanings_and_examples.example: The course covers various aspects of interpersonal communication, including nonverbal cues.
